GRETCHEN WHITMER

ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
January 30, 2025
Larry LaCross
CATHOLIC HUMAN SERVICES INC - TR
1000 HASTINGS ST,
TRAVERSE CITY, MI, 49686-3445
RE: License#: CB280201014
Dear Mr. LaCross
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 01/14/25 The renewal inspection has determined substantial compliance with
applicable licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you will be receiving
the license in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is nontransferable. If
you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way, Area Manager, at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Douglas Turrill, Licensing Consultant
701 S. Elmwood
Traverse City MI 49684
231-383-5531
enclosure
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following area:
• Technical assistance was provided to acting chief administrator regarding
licensing audit processes.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was not requested or offered at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrators annual assessment was reviewed. There was no CAP to
review as the agency was not cited for any rule violations during the last
inspection. The assessment noted they do encounter a lack of interested adoptive

families at times. The assessment also noted there is a lower number of biological
mothers placing children for open adoptions. The assessment noted that staff are
trying to overcome these barriers.
Financial Overview
Financial records were reviewed including a budget and a certified public
accountant annual assessment. No concerns were noted.
Staff and Youth Interviews
The adoption worker was interviewed and reported they are continuing to enjoy
working for the agency. He reported that he has a good working relationship with
his supervisor.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is located in a modern well equipped facility in Traverse City.
There is sufficient office space. CHRI documents were observed to be secured.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The agency is non-contracted, therefore this is not applicable.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their
regular license.
January 30, 2025
_____________________________________
Douglas Turrill Date
Licensing Consultant
